``` java
healthCheckDeactivated = healthCheckDeactivated || Duration.between(...).compareTo(...) < 0;
```

timeline.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyHTML:
An interesting way of doing it. Since some of the builder is the same, I suggest you do either:

LeaderElectionHealthStatus status = isHealthy(...) ? LeaderElectionHealthStatus.HEALTHY : LeaderElectionHealthStatus.UNHEALTHY;
return LeaderElectionReport.builder().status(status).leaderElectionRate(...).build();

or you could inline status to be inside the builder.
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.body: Are we guaranteed that the health check executes from the same thread every time? Even if this is the case, it feels like it would make sense to be defensive against this as this isn't a hot path

timeline.body: This test makes sense for now. The aggregation and/or threshold probably needs revisiting if timelock partitioning is introduced.

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
return healthCheckDeactivated = healthCheckDeactivated && isWithinDeactivationWindow();
if (healthCheckDeactivated) {
return true;
}
boolean shouldBeDeactivated = healthCheckDeactivated && isWithinDeactivationWindow();
healthCheckDeactivated = shouldBeDeactivated;
return shouldBeDeactivated;
timeline.author: jeremyk-91
